UI/UX Designer - NY

Sawhorse Media, a New York technology company is seeking a multitalented UI/UX Designer. Our company, located in the heart of SoHo, creates products that make the social web more fun and useful. We are excited to expand our product team with the right talented and passionate designer.

Muck Rack is our SaaS platform for media professionals and journalists to influence, track and measure the news anywhere around the world. It indexes everything journalists write about, to make it easy to find just the right journalist to pitch a story to.

We also produce the Shorty Awards, an annual award show that honors the best of social media by individuals around the world and some of the best social work by brands and media companies.

Our design and development team is small and nimble, so you will be partly responsible for helping us grow, enact more processes, and make design a larger part of this organization.

About The Position

You’ll be working alongside our designer, product managers and engineering team to enhance the design and user experience of our products and web properties. We are often working on multiple projects at a given time. Some of your responsibilities may include:

  • Conduct user research with our customers, identify pain points and highlight users problems
  • Design and implement new features based on research and feedback
  • Collaborate with developers and product managers to improve existing features
  • Help document our visual design systems for web and print
  • Create modern, responsive user interfaces
  • Improve existing interfaces based on feedback and metrics
  • Help us foster a better design culture and process throughout our company
  • Work on new graphics and layouts for our web properties or print needs

Although this position is primarily based in our SoHo office, Sawhorse employees can work at home or remotely depending on what works best for them and their projects.

About You

You'll be successful if you:

  • Have 2+ years of product design experience, preferably designing for web products (SaaS, enterprise, social, etc)
  • Are able to code your own work in HTML, with at least basic knowledge of SASS, jQuery, and git.
  • Have a strong portfolio that highlights your product design process and visual design skills
  • Be able to see a new feature through from beginning to end: research, ideation, wireframing, iteration, prototype, testing, launch
  • Possess a strong eye for design
  • Have passion and excitement for design and UX
  • Have experience with the Adobe Suite
  • Can conduct user interviews, create personas, etc
  • Have great problem solving and communication skills
  • Are interested in journalism, news, media or social media

How to apply

Send us an email to jobs@sawhorsemedia.com explaining how you fit the bill for the requirements listed above. Include links that demonstrate your best work, whether it's a project you created on GitHub, your portfolio, your Dribbble profile, a blog post you've written, or something you've made in a completely different medium.

Emails from recruiters will not be considered.

Benefits!

Vacations

We encourage taking real off the grid vacations.


VIP Shorty Awards Ticket

Whether or not you’re working on our Shorty Awards product, you’ll score a VIP invite to the annual Shorty Awards show. We promise it’ll be a blast!


Personal development

We encourage everyone to grow their skills and networks and will enable you to attend relevant events, conferences and meetups. We believe in the need to get out of the office and see the world, experience the market and learn from peers.

Equipment

We’ll provide you with a high-end MacBook Pro, second screen monitor and anything else you might need to do your job (software, drawing tablets, adapters, etc.).


Health benefits

You’ll be able to join our health plan which has one of the largest networks of providers in the tri state area. Sawhorse will cover half the cost.


Snacks!

We have an ongoing FreshDirect order that everyone can add to to make sure there are delicious and healthy snacks in the office throughout the week.
